article_title: Herkimer board to vote on budget

article_metadata.description:
HERKIMER — The Herkimer village board is scheduled to meet at 7 p.m. on April 28 to adopt a $6.42 million budget for the 2016-17 fiscal year.
The $6,424,283 spending plan is lower than the $6.48 million budget presented at an April 14 public hearing and approved.
The board met in a special session Monday for a budget workshop after learning the original budget would put the village over its constitutional tax limit, according to Mayor Tony Brindisi
Village Clerk Treasurer Amanda Viscomi
article_metadata.author: Donna Thompsondonna@timestelegram.com
